illnessScript.summary: Chest pain in primary care: rapidly separate life-threatening cardiopulmonary causes from common non-cardiac pain while documenting risk clearly.

mustNotMiss.whyDangerous: Missed ischemia can lead to arrhythmia, heart failure, or sudden death.
mustNotMiss.escalationConcern: Emergency referral for suspected ACS symptoms or unstable observations.

whenHelpful.rationale: Helps detect physiological instability during consultation.
Used when findings will change immediate management.
Reserve for diagnostic uncertainty or higher risk presentations.

selfCare: Provide symptom-control advice tailored to current severity.
Confirm patient understands red-flag escalation instructions.
followUpLogic: Escalate immediately for any features of ACS, PE, dissection, or pneumothorax.
Use documented risk factors to determine urgency of investigation and referral.
Safety-net explicitly for recurrence, worsening pain, syncope, or breathlessness.

returnAdvice: Call emergency services for persistent chest pain, collapse, or severe breathlessness.
Seek urgent reassessment for new radiation of pain, vomiting, or sweating.
Return urgently if symptoms worsen despite initial treatment plan.
